definitions.title: n.m.
definitions.body: daughter's husband, bride-groom (as one who undergoes circumcision, v. supr.; NH id.; Aram. [[חַתְנׇא]], and h.atno0 (also sister's husband, etc.); vulg. Ar. xatanun daughter's husband, then more gen. wife's and husband's relations; Sab. (Liḥyân) [[חַתן]] daughter's husband DHM:Epigr. Denkm. 87; As. ḫatanu, daughter's husband COT:Gloss)—abs. ´[[ח]] 1Sa 18:18 + 10 t. + Ge 19:12 (where rd. [[חֲחָנֶיךָ]] LXX Ol Di); cstr. [[חֲתַן]] Ex 4:23 + 4 t.; sf. [[חֲתָנוֹ]] Ju Jdg 19:5; [[חֲתָנׇיו]] Ge 19:14, Ge 19:14; —

in relation to a father, daughter's husband, or bridegroom Ge 19:12, Ge 19:14 ([[לֽקְחֵי בְּנׁתָיו]] ´[[ח]]), v:Ge 19:14 (all J), Ju Jdg 15:6, Jdg 19:5, 1Sa 18:18, 1Sa 22:14, Ne 6:18, Ne 13:28; v. also [[חֲתַן בֵּית אַחְאָב]] 2Ki 8:27 son-in-law of the house of Ahad, said of Ahaziah, whose mother Athaliah was the daughter of Ahab.

in relation to the bride, bridegroom [[דָּמִים אַתָּה לִי]] ´[[ח]] Ex 4:25 a bloody bridegroom art thou to me, cf. v:Ex 4:26 (J; on this v. We:Prol. 1886, 355); ‖[[כַּלָּה]] Je 7:34, Je 16:9, Je 25:10, Je 33:11, Joe 2:16; in sim. of ´[[י]]'s work for and delight in his people Is 61:10, Is 62:5; of sun Ps 19:6.
